definition: to follow blindly/to conform slavishly/unthinking obedience
blind
surname Cong

from/through/via/to follow/to obey/to engage in (an activity)/never (in negative sentence)/(Taiwan pr. [zong4]) retainer/assistant/auxiliary/subordinate/related by common paternal grandfather or earlier ancestor

sentences.english: The psychological cause refers to the sequacious and the fluke mind.
sentences.chinese: 心理原因指盲从与侥幸心理使然。

sentences.english: Social media backers take that ignominious episode in stride.
sentences.chinese: 社会媒体的支持者对这种盲从的小插曲并不反对。

sentences.english: Don't aimlessly listen to those around you.
sentences.chinese: 不要盲从于你周围的人。

sentences.english: Mr Luxun had been alert to obeying the public and deifying the public.
sentences.chinese: 盲从大众，神化大众，一直是鲁迅所警惕的。

sentences.english: Blind faith and impetuosity have led them into their present difficulties.
sentences.chinese: 盲从和狂热使他们陷入目前的困境。

sentences.english: It is silly to is a slave to social convention.
sentences.chinese: 对社会习俗盲从是愚蠢的。

sentences.english: He didn't live off other people's faith, and that is admirable.
sentences.chinese: 他没有盲从别人的信仰，这是值得敬佩的。

sentences.english: Buckley ended up riding history, and even guiding it.
sentences.chinese: 巴克利不盲从历史，甚至指引发展的方向。

sentences.english: It rejected blind obedience to authority, whether religious or political.
sentences.chinese: 它拒绝盲从权威，无论是宗教的还是政治的。

sentences.english: The sheeple (sheep people) thus are resigned to their lot.
sentences.chinese: 盲从的人因此应自己托付给他们的宿命。

sentences.english: Is not blind obedience is each other, and accepting good advice.
sentences.chinese: 不盲从是取长补短，择善而从。

definition: to say what everyone says (idiom)/to conform to what one perceives to be the majority view/to follow the herd
to follow the crowd/going with the tide
blind/blindly/ignorant/lacking understanding
selective listening/to hear what one wants to hear
reason/rationality/rational
to jump to an unfounded conclusion
to drift with the waves and go with the flow (idiom); to follow the crowd blindly
not following the crowd/to go against the tide
doctrine/dogma/creed/dogmatic
blindly/invariably
to follow/(of a woman) to get married/(old) attendant
reason/intellect/rationality/rational
seeking instant benefit (idiom); shortsighted vision, looking only for fast return
to persist in one's views
to distinguish right and wrong (idiom)
to follow the crowd/to conform
